why_use_it.title: Engineering Without Borders
why_use_it.subtitle: We've eliminated the friction of the legacy development cycle.

offline.title: Local-First Intelligence

paradigm.title: Deterministic Sandboxing

no_prompt.title: Promptless Orchestration

token_strategy.title: Token Strategy

mcp_native.title: Native MCP Integration
mcp_native.description: Direct connection with Model Context Protocol and VS Code extensions. Your current tools, now with agentic superpowers.

visual_codebase.title: Visual Codebase

go_see_it.title: Initialize Your Swarm

mod0.name: Mod0
mod0.description: Mod0 orchestrates specialized agents to handle the complexity of modern development. From Thinking Graphs to Kanban execution, it provides the deterministic infrastructure for next-generation software engineering.

features.title: Precision Core Features
features.subtitle: The first autonomous environment equipped with real-time reasoning visualization and agentic orchestration.

f1.title: Thinking Graph Visualizer
f1.description: Observe the real-time reasoning path of your agents. Monitor every decision, branch, and logic path in a live interactive graph.

f2.title: Agentic Kanban Board
f2.description: Manage autonomous workflows with a specialized Kanban. Assign tasks to agent clusters and monitor execution progress in parallel.

f3.title: Native Code Generation
f3.description: Agents write, refactor, and deploy code directly into your repositories with technical precision and zero-supervision mode.

f4.title: Neural Logic Engine
f4.description: Our proprietary inference layer ensures agents respond and execute complex reasoning in near real-time with low latency.

f5.title: Hardened Sandbox
f5.description: Execute agentic tasks in isolated, secure environments. Bank-level encryption and SOC 2 compliance for your data privacy.

f6.title: GitHub Core Sync
f6.description: Deep integration with your repositories. Agents understand your technical debt, project history, and code standards.

f7.title: Autonomous Self-Healing
f7.description: Automated debugging and error correction. When a process fails, agents identify the root cause and apply an autonomous patch.

f8.title: Performance Analytics
f8.description: Full traceability of every thought and token spent. Visualize success rates and optimize your agentic workflows with ease.

f9.title: Multi-Agent Swarms
f9.description: Coordinate multiple specialized agents working together. Scale from one to hundreds of instances instantly without overhead.

how_it_works.title: Operational Workflow
how_it_works.subtitle: From command-line initialization to visual autonomous orchestration.

step_1.title: Initialize & Define
step_1.description: Start with `mod0 init`. Define your objective and set the agentic boundaries for the environment.

step_2.title: Contextual Ingestion
step_2.description: Connect your stack. The system indexes your codebase to build a multi-dimensional mental model.

step_3.title: Graph Reasoning
step_3.description: Visualize the Thinking Graph. Review the agent's logic branches and task breakdown before execution.

step_4.title: Kanban Orchestration
step_4.description: Tasks are dispatched to the Agentic Kanban where specialized worker agents take ownership of each card.

step_5.title: Autonomous Execution
step_5.description: Agents operate in hardened sandboxes, writing and refactoring code with built-in self-healing protocols.

step_6.title: Trace & Validate
step_6.description: Review the complete execution trace and reasoning logs. Approve the final output and deploy.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about the Mod0 intelligent editor

q1.q: How is Mod0 different from Cursor or Windsurf?
q1.a: Unlike other editors that just suggest code, Mod0 understands the 'why'. While others focus on autocomplete, Mod0 uses the Thinking Graph to reason about the entire architecture before writing, preventing logic errors.

q2.q: What exactly is the Thinking Graph?
q2.a: It's our AI's 'mind'. It's a visual map that shows the editor's reasoning: which files it analyzes and why it made a technical decision. It's like having a Senior Dev explaining their process in real-time.

q3.q: How does the Visual Codebase work?
q3.a: Forget reading cryptic diffs. Mod0 shows changes graphically, letting you visually understand how a new function affects other files through dependency graphs.

q4.q: Can I use my own API keys (BYOK)?
q4.a: Yes. You can use our optimized infrastructure or connect your own keys from Anthropic, OpenAI, or Google. You decide which model to use and control your spending.

q5.q: Is my code used to train models?
q5.a: No. Your code is private. We do not train models on our users' data. Additionally, with Local Nodes, you can run the AI entirely privately on your own network.
